thinking.disposable_income: Middle-income neighborhood with median household income around $65,000. Many working families with moderate disposable income. About 10% poverty rate indicates some economic constraints
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Moderate discretionary spending capacity. Residents are price-sensitive but can afford some additional transportation costs. Many households have significant retail spending in local commercial districts
thinking.accessibility: Mixed transit access - served by Blue Line and multiple bus routes but not as extensive as downtown areas. High car ownership rates (80%+ households). Many residents commute by car to work. Good road network with access to expressways
thinking.decision_rationale:
1. Prioritize balanced options that don't overly burden drivers while improving transit
2. Moderate tax rates preferred given middle-income status
3. Lower transit fares beneficial for transit-dependent residents
4. Some driving fees acceptable to fund improvements if balanced with benefits
5. Selected proposals that reduce transit travel times without excessive costs
6. Ranked proposals with 1% tax higher as they balance revenue needs and affordability
7. Preferred proposals that reduce both car and transit travel times
